discoveredAssets: localhost:5001 - Dalgona Challenges XSS CTF Platform - Flask/Werkzeug 1.0.1, Python 2.7.18 (EOL) - Port 5001
localhost:5001/static/ - Static assets directory (CSS, images) - Directory listing disabled

targets.objective: Test for XSS vulnerabilities, Python 2.7/Werkzeug 1.0.1 exploits, authentication bypass, session management flaws, SSTI (Flask/Jinja2), and investigate the referenced but non-functional xss25 challenge endpoint
targets.rationale: Security challenge application running on outdated Python 2.7.18 (EOL since 2020) and Werkzeug 1.0.1 (outdated). The application advertises an 'XSS 25' challenge that returns 404, suggesting either hidden endpoints, parameter-based access, or broken functionality. Flask applications are susceptible to SSTI. Only GET/HEAD/OPTIONS methods allowed on root. No authentication observed. High risk due to EOL Python version with known vulnerabilities.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Python 2.7.18 detected - End-of-Life (EOL) since January 2020, contains numerous known vulnerabilities
[HIGH] Werkzeug 1.0.1 detected - Outdated version with potential security vulnerabilities
[HIGH] XSS25 challenge endpoint referenced in homepage but returns 404 - potential hidden functionality or access control issue
[MEDIUM] HTTP/1.0 protocol in use - outdated protocol version
[MEDIUM] Flask application detected - susceptible to SSTI if user input is rendered in templates
[LOW] Directory listing disabled on /static/ - good security practice
[LOW] No robots.txt, sitemap.xml, or security.txt present
[INFO] Only GET, HEAD, OPTIONS methods allowed on root endpoint (POST returns 405)
[INFO] No authentication mechanisms observed on publicly accessible pages
[INFO] Static assets served with 12-hour cache control headers
